intro: Vignea capitata, commonly known as the clustered morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Vignea capitata thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its rapid growth and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, climbing plants.
